Relevant functions for interaction with DBs:

- `cdm_copy_to()`
- `cdm_set_key_constraints()`
- `cdm_learn_from_db()`

In order to work with databases, you first need to connect to one.

```{r}
#Â real life example? can also use a different one
library(dm)
library(dplyr)
library(DBI)
con <- src_mysql(
  dbname = "company",
  host = "courses.csrrinzqubik.us-east-1.rds.amazonaws.com",
  port = 3306,
  user = "student",
  password = "datacamp"
)
```

# `cdm_copy_to()`

Having connected, we can transfer some data into the database. 
In {dm}, we do this using `cdm_copy_to()`. 

```{r}
cdm_copy_to(con, cdm_nycflights13())
```
